column4: lol that's what I did the last time I installed cuttlefish, but when I was in here last night it sounded way complicated to use the second partition (logical) to install new programs.
and after all the updates required when installing ub. 10 luc. it leaves me with about 2 gig space for more programs.
it's very bad when the updates are taking up 50% of the expected system space
hmm not sure about symlinks. gotta google it. I've only used Ubuntu for a few days now.
yeah I was using bleachbit for that soreau

hmm, last person I asked about installations said that they go to usr/bin or bins but how do I know after installing a package what files go where because frankly the bin folder just looks like a mess
and I can't tell what files are associated with what apps, they seem mixed up.
/usr/bin is a common directory for program binaries, but it is not the only place they are put
and many times it is up to you where they go
either search, or just find out from wherever you got the software
as long as that location is in your path
it could be on a network drive, external, whatever, as long as that drive is mounted, and the location is on your path
if the location is not on your path you would need to use the canonical name to launch it
you can see what is on it by typing echo $PATH at command line
hey sorry, this isnt really help, just curious how you set up an account without a password in the first place. I wasnt aware you could even do that
follow ActionParsnip advice and see what happens. If that doesn't work try typing just passwd at the terminal as the account you are trying to update
i think it will indeed make you login, unless ubuntu also has a auto login that I am unaware of too
